item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Sunday, March 16, 2025 at 1:20 PM UTC
item.description:
1. French gov's open source alternative to Notion or Outline (103 points | 14 comments)
2. Learn You Some Erlang for Great Good (13 points | discuss)
3. Show HN: My high school team's space probe (65 points | 13 comments)
4. Big LLMs weights are a piece of history (8 points | 1 comment)
5. Lynx is the oldest web browser still being maintained (115 points | 58 comments)
6. City simulator I made in Scratch (39 points | 1 comment)
7. Show HN: Nash, I made a standalone note with single HTML file (408 points | 96 comments)
8. Apple's long-lost hidden recovery partition from 1994 has been found (190 points | 55 comments)
9. Lago (Open-Source Usage Based Billing)Is Hiring Sr Ruby Engineers (Latam) ( | hide)
10. Styling an HTML dialog modal to take the full height of the viewport (6 points | discuss)
11. Implications of Global Privacy Control (25 points | 13 comments)
12. The good times in tech are over (73 points | 79 comments)
13. Command A: Max performance, minimal compute – 256k context window (31 points | 5 comments)
14. Sign in as anyone: Bypassing SAML SSO authentication with parser differentials (261 points | 97 comments)
15. High-performance computing, with much less code (17 points | 2 comments)
16. Milk Kanban (385 points | 152 comments)
17. GPT 4.5 level for 1% of the price (193 points | 118 comments)
18. Undergraduate Upends a 40-Year-Old Data Science Conjecture (18 points | 1 comment)
19. Wyvern's Open Satellite Feed (176 points | 10 comments)
20. Show HN: A personal YouTube frontend based on yt-dlp (273 points | 178 comments)
21. ESP32 WiFi Superstitions (95 points | 55 comments)
22. The British Nationality Act as a Prolog Program (1986) [pdf] (5 points | 1 comment)
23. Career Advice in 2025 (216 points | 115 comments)
24. How many artists' careers did the Beatles kill? (180 points | 166 comments)
25. More pro for the DEC Professional 380 (featuring PRO/VENIX) (33 points | 4 comments)
26. Lego says it wants to start to bring video game development in-house (118 points | 64 comments)
27. DeepSeek focuses on research over revenue (108 points | 58 comments)
28. Toni Morrison's Lost Play (4 points | discuss)
29. Strengthening AI Agent Hijacking Evaluations (35 points | 11 comments)
30. Evidence that Neanderthal and Homo sapiens engaged in cultural exchange (93 points | 65 comments)
